tourBios.exmtStatus: Fully Exempt: # Nearest 50 - 1st Web.com Tour qualifier at 2012 PGA TOUR Qualifying Tournament
tourBios.curYearHigh: Made a run at his second European Tour title and first since 2011 when he forced overtime at the Africa Open. Finished regulation tied with Thomas Aiken but could only par the first sudden-death hole to Aiken's birdie. The second-place finish was worth €115,000.
tourBios.carHigh:
2012: Made the cut in 11 of 21 starts on the European Tour, with five top-25 finishes. Attended the PGA TOUR Qualifying Tournament, missing getting his 2013 card by a stroke. Entered the final round T39 and carded a 3-under 69 to wind up at 16-under. Birdied Nos. 15, 16 and 17 to reach 17-under par and needed only a par on the final hole at the Stadium Course at PGA West to secure his card.

2011: Had not finished better than 35th in any tournament on the European Tour when he traveled to the Czech Open. After opening with a 71, shot rounds of 67-68 to move into a tie for the lead through 54 holes, with Steven O'Hara. Fired a final-round 69 to win by two strokes over Mikael Lundburg to claim his first Tour title...Previous-best finish this season was a T35 at the Nordea Masters. 

2010: Had five straight top-10s in five starts in early spring. Opened with an eighth-place showing at the Avantha Masters on the European Tour...Took a six-week break and then made his next start on the European Challenge Tour, at the Kenya Open, where he finished third...Two weeks later, back on the Eurpean Tour, at the Madeira Islands Open, shot back-to-back 65s on the weekend at Porto Santo Golfe at the Madeira Islands Open but still fell one stroke shy of winner James Morrison...The following week, was seventh at the Volvo China Open...Finished his top-10 stretch with a T4 at the Ballantine's Open. 2009: Did not record a European Tour top 10. Best showing was a T12 at the Portugal Masters. Was tied for ninth going into the final round, six strokes behind Retief Goosen. Shot a final-round 70. 2008: Came close to winning his first European Tour title, at the Open de Andalucia. Shot a pair of 67s on the weekend at Aloha GC and moved to the 72nd hole with a one-shot lead over Thomas Levet. An errant tee shot led to a bogey that forced a playoff with Levet that the Frenchman ultimately won...Had three other top-10s—a T9 at the Michael Hill New Zealand Open, a T8 at the SAS Championship and a T7 at the French Open.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Was just 16 years old when he became the youngest player ever to play in the Walker Cup, representing Great Britain and Ireland at the Chicago GC in 2005...Also became the youngest Briton to earn a spot on the European Tour at the 2006 Qualifying School. Played the event as an amateur and turned professional after earning his card.

tourBios.curYearHigh: Made a run at his second European Tour title and first since 2011 when he forced overtime at the Africa Open. Finished regulation tied with Thomas Aiken but could only par the first sudden-death hole to Aiken's birdie. The second-place finish was worth €115,000.
tourBios.carHigh:
2013: Made a pair of top-15s on the European Tour. First came at the Trophy Hassan II, a T15...Picked up a T11 at the KLM Open in mid-September following a 67-65 start that left him a stroke out of the Miguel Angel Jimenez-Pablo Larrazabal lead through 36 holes...Was also T12 at the Hong Kong Open on the Asian Tour. 

2012: Had five top-25s on the European Tour, his best finish coming in his first start, at the Volvo Golf Champions, a T12...Added a T19 at the Omega European Masters...Two weeks later, was T15 at the Alfred Dunhill Links Championship...A week later, was T16 at the BMW Masters.

2011: Had not finished better than 35th in any tournament on the European Tour when he traveled to the Czech Open. After opening with a 71, shot rounds of 67-68 to move into a tie for the lead through 54 holes, with Steven O'Hara. Fired a final-round 69 to win by two strokes over Mikael Lundburg to claim his first Tour title...Previous-best finish this season was a T35 at the Nordea Masters. 

2010: Had five straight top-10s in five starts in early spring. Opened with an eighth-place showing at the Avantha Masters on the European Tour...Took a six-week break and then made his next start on the European Challenge Tour, at the Kenya Open, where he finished third...Two weeks later, back on the Eurpean Tour, at the Madeira Islands Open, shot back-to-back 65s on the weekend at Porto Santo Golfe at the Madeira Islands Open but still fell one stroke shy of winner James Morrison...The following week, was seventh at the Volvo China Open...Finished his top-10 stretch with a T4 at the Ballantine's Open. 

2009: Did not record a European Tour top 10. Best showing was a T12 at the Portugal Masters. Was tied for ninth going into the final round, six strokes behind Retief Goosen. Shot a final-round 70. 

2008: Came close to winning his first European Tour title, at the Open de Andalucia. Shot a pair of 67s on the weekend at Aloha GC and moved to the 72nd hole with a one-shot lead over Thomas Levet. An errant tee shot led to a bogey that forced a playoff with Levet that the Frenchman ultimately won...Had three other top-10s—a T9 at the Michael Hill New Zealand Open, a T8 at the SAS Championship and a T7 at the French Open.
